SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.real

Class RealNumber

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector2
civitas.celestis.math.real.RealNumber
All Implemented Interfaces:
Numeric, Vector, Serializable, Comparable<RealNumber>
public class RealNumber extends Vector2 implements Comparable<RealNumber>
A scientific notation of a number using two doubles. The format is "2^x * y".

The minimum possible value of a real number is
"Math.pow(Double.MIN_VALUE, 2) * Double.MIN_VALUE",
and the maximum possible value of a real number is
"Math.pow(Double.MAX_VALUE, 2) * Double.MAX_VALUE".

A real number can be used to represent numbers beyond the limits of double.

See Also:
  • MIN_VALUE
  • MAX_VALUE
  • Serialized Form

    • toReadableString

      @Nonnull public String toReadableString()
      Converts this number into a format "0.####...". This will infinitely calculate the decimal points. This uses the math context MathContext.DECIMAL128.
      Returns:
      The human-readable string representation of this number

    • toReadableString

      Converts this number into a format "0.####...". This will infinitely calculate the decimal points.
      Parameters:
      context - The mathematical context to use when calculating the value
      Returns:
      The human-readable string representation of this number
